meanings.sent1: After the chaos, they needed to reregulate the situation.
meanings.sent2: The government decided to reregulate the industry to ensure fair competition.
meanings.sent3: The dance class had to reregulate their routine after the music suddenly changed.
meanings.sent4: Just like a thermostat, she could reregulate her emotions to stay calm.
meanings.sent5: The chef had to reregulate the temperature of the oven to bake the perfect cake.

meanings.sent1: She had to reregulate the volume on the TV after it suddenly got too loud.
meanings.sent2: The pilot needed to reregulate the plane's altitude to avoid turbulence.
meanings.sent3: The teacher had to reregulate the classroom noise level after a surprise visit from the principal.
meanings.sent4: Just like a captain steering a ship, he could reregulate his focus to stay on course.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic had to reregulate the engine to make the car run smoothly again.
